title: Bangladesh to hold first vote since uprising
byline: Bangladesh will hold parliamentary elections on Feb 12, authorities said, its first national vote since a deadly student-led uprising forced then Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to flee to India last year.

title: Over 30 major reservoirs continue to spill – Irrigation Dept.
byline: Several river basins have received more than 50 millimeters of rainfall during the past 24 hours, Irrigation Department Director (Hydrology and Disaster Management) Eng. L. S. Sooriyabandara said this morning (12).

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island today
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Northern and North-Central provinces and in Puttalam and Trincomalee districts, today (12), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Thai PM moves to dissolve parliament, setting stage for elections
byline: Thailand’s Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul announced on Thursday that he is “returning power to the people,” moving to dissolve parliament and clear the way for elections earlier than previously anticipated.

title: Two police officers arrested over Rs. 5,000 bribe
byline: A Police Constable and a Police Sergeant attached to the Diyabeduma Police Station have been arrested by Bribery Commission officers yesterday (11) on charges of seeking a bribe of Rs. 5,000 from a motorcyclist.

title: Former Speaker Asoka Ranwala hospitalised after vehicle involved in accident
byline: Further information has been revealed regarding the accident involving a jeep driven by former Speaker and Member of Parliament Asoka Ranwala, which resulted in a head-on collision with a car.

title: Magnitude 6.7 earthquake hits Japan’s northeast region, tsunami advisory issued
byline: An earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 6.7 hit Japan’s northeastern region on Friday, prompting a tsunami advisory for waves up to 1 metre (39 inch) high from the Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA).

title: Government issues revised excise license fee structure
byline: The Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development has issued Excise Notification No. 03/2025, introducing a revised fee structure for excise-related licenses across multiple categories.

title: Suspect wanted on 88 warrants arrested in Athurugiriya
byline: A suspect wanted on 88 warrants has been arrested by the Athurugiriya Police officers yesterday (11).

title: Bulgarian government resigns after weeks of street protests
byline: Bulgaria’s government resigned on Thursday after less than a year in power, following weeks of street protests over its economic policies and its perceived failure to tackle corruption.

title: Singapore to contribute US$100,000 to support relief efforts in Sri Lanka
byline: The Singapore government will contribute US$100,000 (S$129,000) as seed money to support the Singapore Red Cross’ (SRC) public fundraising efforts for the humanitarian crisis resulting from the recent cyclone in Sri Lanka.

title: Australia strengthens educational, migration, and security partnerships with Sri Lanka
byline: The Australian High Commission in Sri Lanka has highlighted a recent visit by Australia’s Assistant Minister for Citizenship, Customs and Multicultural Affairs, and International Education, Julian Hill, aimed at strengthening Australia–Sri Lanka relations across multiple sectors.

title: ADB approves $200M to improve water, food security in North Central Sri Lanka
byline: The Asian Development Bank (ADB) has approved a $200 million loan to support the ongoing Mahaweli Development Program, Sri Lanka’s largest multiuse water resources development initiative.

title: Former Speaker and NPP MP Asoka Ranwala arrested
byline: Former Speaker and NPP Member of Parliament Asoka Ranwala, who was involved in a vehicular collision in Sapugaskanda last night, has been arrested by the police.

title: Bus driver saves 14 passenger lives after brake failure in Badulla
byline: The driver of a bus belonging to the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) Depot in Kekirawa, operating from Badulla to Anuradhapura this morning (12), has reportedly managed to save the lives of 14 passengers by carefully steering the vehicle into an embankment after its brakes suddenly failed.

title: Trump signs order to block states from enforcing own AI rules
byline: US President Donald Trump has signed an executive order aimed at blocking states from enforcing their own artificial intelligence (AI) regulations.

title: Foreign humanitarian aid to be systematically distributed, Sri Lankan officials confirm
byline: Deputy Minister of Defence, Major General (Rtd) Aruna Jayasekara, together with members of the committee appointed to ensure the proper coordination and distribution of foreign humanitarian aid, conducted an inspection visit today (12) at the Orugodawatta Warehouse Complex...

title: Disney to invest $1 billion in OpenAI, license characters for Sora video tool
byline: Walt Disney is investing $1 billion in OpenAI and will let the startup use characters from Star Wars, Pixar and Marvel franchises in its Sora AI video generator, a deal that could reshape how Hollywood makes content.

title: Gold prices in Sri Lanka increase by around Rs. 3,000 today
byline: Gold prices in Sri Lanka have risen following a significant increase in the price of gold in the world market.

title: Game of the Year 2025 — Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 breaks records with 9 awards across categories
byline: Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 became the central headline of The Game Awards 2025 after sweeping nine awards across major categories, including the top honour, Game of the Year.

title: District Secretary urges drivers to avoid nighttime travel to Nuwara Eliya
byline: Nuwara Eliya District Secretary Thushari Tennakoon has urged motorists to refrain from using any roads leading into Nuwara Eliya during nighttime hours, citing heightened landslide risks caused by prevailing weather conditions.

title: Nine dead as bus crashes into ravine amid heavy fog in India
byline: Nine people died and dozens were injured after a bus lost control and plunged into a ravine on a hilly stretch in Andhra Pradesh’s Alluri district in India this morning. The incident took place near the Tulasipakalu village.

title: Suspect arrested for Rs. 6.86 million online fraud via Telegram
byline: The North Western Provincial Sub-Unit of the Computer Crime Investigation Division has arrested a suspect for allegedly defrauding money via the internet.

title: Landslide red warnings extended as NBRO cautions against unnecessary travel
byline: The National Building Research Organization (NBRO) has announced that the ‘Level-3’ (Red) landslide evacuation warnings currently issued to 33 Divisional Secretariat Divisions (DSDs) across four districts have been further extended.

title: Reddit sues Australia over social media ban, citing free speech threat
byline: Message board website Reddit on Friday filed a lawsuit in Australia’s highest court seeking to overturn the country’s social media ban for children, calling it an intrusion on free political discourse and setting the stage for a protracted legal battle.

title: Cabinet approves women’s recruitment for all positions in Sri Lanka Railways – AG tells court
byline: The Attorney General informed the Supreme Court today (12) that the Cabinet of Ministers has approved the recruitment of women for all positions within the Sri Lanka Railways (SLR).

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for severe lightning in the Kalutara, Ratnapura, Galle and Matara Districts.

title: Govt to provide Rs. 5,000 nutrition allowance to pregnant mothers
byline: The government has announced that, in light of the nationwide prevailing disaster situation and the upcoming festive season, arrangements have been made to provide a nutrition allowance of Rs. 5,000 to pregnant mothers.

title: Police vow impartial probe into vehicle collision involving MP Asoka Ranwala
byline: Sapugaskanda Police Station has initiated an investigation into a head-on collision involving a vehicle driven by former Speaker and NPP Member of Parliament Asoka Ranwala, which injured several including an infant.

title: Wijeyadasa to be appointed SLFP Senior Vice President
byline: Former Member of Parliament, President’s Counsel Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe, is slated to be appointed as a Senior Vice President of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP).

title: Sri Lankan-led UK team harnesses AI to strengthen Sri Lanka’s disaster readiness
byline:
How Sri Lanka Can Rebuild Stronger After Cyclone Ditwah:
Advanced Artificial Intelligence Technologies Offer a New Hope for Disaster Prediction, Management & Recovery... By Dr. Nalinda Somasiri

title: Budget defeated at NPP-held Ratnapura MC
byline: The maiden 2026 budget of the Ratnapura Municipal Council, which is under the control of the National People’s Power (NPP), has been defeated by a majority of a single vote.

title: Eurovision winner Nemo to return trophy in protest at Israel
byline: The winner of last year’s Eurovision Song Contest, Nemo, has said they are returning their trophy in protest over Israel’s continued participation in the event.

title: Former Speaker Asoka Ranwala granted bail
byline: Former Speaker and NPP Parliamentarian Asoka Ranwala, who was arrested over the vehicular collision at Sapugaskanda last night (11), has been granted bail, according to the Police Spokesman.

title: Houses completely destroyed by adverse weather exceeds 5,700 - DMC
byline: The Disaster Management Center (DMC) reports that more than 5,700 houses have been completely destroyed due to the severe adverse weather conditions experienced recently across the country.

title: Former Beliatta PS Chairman remanded
byline: The former Chairman of the Beliatta Pradeshiya Sabha, Cyril Munasinghe, who was arrested by the Bribery Commission this morning (12), has been remanded until December 22 by the Colombo Magistrate’s Court.

title: Sri Lanka expresses gratitude to China for support after Cyclone Ditwah
byline: Sri Lanka’s Minister of Foreign Affairs, Vijitha Herath, welcomed Yang Wanming, President of the Chinese People’s Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries, at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism today (12).

title: Thai PM says no ceasefire yet in Cambodia conflict after phone call with Trump
byline: Thai Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul confirmed on Friday that there was no ceasefire yet with Cambodia and said he had spoken by telephone with U.S. President Donald Trump and told him Bangkok was not the aggressor in the conflict with its neighbour.

title: CEO of insurance company granted bail over bribery incident
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered the release on bail of the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of an insurance company arrested in connection with a bribery incident involving a former Assistant Government Analyst, who is currently in remand custody.
